column4: Hello all. I got a USB key that takes forever to mount, like several minutes, it's FAT formated. Any advice, is it the device or Ubuntu's fault ? Thanks.
If not, it's possibly just the device.  Try scanning the disk on a Windows box or copying your data off and recreating the fat filesystem
Nothing really alarming in dmesg | tail and I already did that, formatting it under Windows
I've had similar when I've yanked them out without "safely ejecting" :)
Ya, I think so too :) But how to fix it now if formatting doesn't help ? Here's my dmesg | tail if you want to take a look - http://paste.ubuntu.com/380335/
I would expect to see errors about it settling if the stick was dodgy
I thought so. Yesterday it had a bad superblock alert but I achieved to format but now it takes 5 minutes to automount.
Hrrrrrm, it _could_ be the stick going faulty but fixing itself (they have a small amount of extra storage for bad blocks)
And the host machine would know nothing about it
Time to buy a new stick?  They are less than $10 nowadays ;)
The strange thing is that it's brand new. I bought it yesterday :)
So you think it's a faulty device ?
I dunno, it could be.  That's not normal.  Have you got another machine to try it on?
Ok, I don't get it, it mounts instantly on my older box, also running Karmic. :/
Hm, could either be your hardware or karmic then I guess!
